summary:
Nebraska is a state in the middle of the United States, with no coastline. It's bordered by six other states and is known for its diverse landscape. The eastern part has rolling hills, while the west is mostly flat prairie. The state has a unique legislature where members don't represent political parties.

Nebraska was home to many Native American tribes before European settlers arrived. The building of the Transcontinental Railroad and new laws giving away free land brought many new people and helped Nebraska's agriculture grow.
title: Nebraska
